page.title: 02GAZETTEER/LIFE STYLES
page.content: {Sea}but lately there has been a decline. Tourism now plays a large part in our area's economy. Although {Shetland}is very isolated with few towns and villages it is as modern as elsewhere. When oil was discovered in the{North Sea}many men came to work here and on the rigs. They improved the airport and built many houses. The influence of new people was both good and bad for the area. The main shops are in {Lerwick} which is 25 miles away but we do have mobile services, 3 bank, library and grocery vans. To go to church people have to travel north,but there is a Sunday School locally in the{Memorial Hall.}There are no schools in our area,primary children travel 6km and secondary 18km. However traditional life continues.
